other_tests.findings: Presumptive diagnosis of chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP) was made; transient improvement in sensation and strength in her legs and hands was noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hypoesthesia and weakness progressed to involve both arms.

other_tests.findings: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) showed 15 total nucleated cells (predominantly neutrophils) and a protein level of 45 mg/dl.

Normal sensory responses except for mildly reduced amplitude of the right ulnar nerve; marked attenuation in motor responses, with severely reduced responses in fibular motor and posterior tibial muscles. Scattered fibrillation potentials were noted.
Right median somatosensory evoked potential was normal; absent P37 scalp waveform in the right tibial somatosensory evoked potential suggested disruption of central conduction.
